channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024040129
item.description:
Report E-2024040129

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-06
  • City: NEW COLUMBIA
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XMI contacted ERTS regarding a punctured supersac containing 100Y Litharge Lead Monoxide. The supersac was punctured by a forklift resulting in the release of approximately 1lb of product onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2’x2’ area. A Contractor responded at a scheduled time to perform a supersac transfer and clean-up the released product. A CUYD and a 55-gallon DF was generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040152
item.description:
Report E-2024040152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: TOMAH
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XTM contacted ERTS regarding a punctured leaking tote containing Predator MR2516. The tote was punctured by a forklift and released approximately 35-gallons of product onto the wooden trailer floor and concrete underneath the trailer. The trailer floor impact area was 18'x18' and the impact area underneath the trailer was 8'x20'. A Contractor performed a tote transfer, cut-up pallets that were impacted by the release, and cleaned-up the release on the trailer floor. Five drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

item.title: Report E-2024040144
item.description:
Report E-2024040144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-04
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XNJ contacted ERTS regarding (6) damaged 1-gallon jugs of Heavy Duty Foam Degreaser that fell during transit as a result of improper loading / improper blocking and bracing. Approximately 2-gallons of product released onto the concrete dock floor. A Contractor overpacked the damaged product and neutralized the impacted boxes, plastic, cardboard, and trash can liners using Citri Acid. Three drums of waste were generated for disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were affected by this incident.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XVL contacted ERTS regarding an incident that occurred at a customer’s location. During the off-loading process, a bag containing product SODIUM SULFIDE -FLAKES 60-62 % got caught on the side of the trailer and released approximately 5lbs of production a 1’x1’area onto the wooden trailer floor. A Contractor cleaned up the release and overpacked the damaged bag of product. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this spill.

item.title: Report E-2024040130
item.description:
Report E-2024040130

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-10T15:11:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-02
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of resin solution was punctured by the shipper's skid and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel utilized hand tools, cleaners, absorbents, and a sprayer unit to remediate the site. All spent absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into two (2) 35-gallon drums. The damaged 55-gallon drum of product was placed into one (1) 85-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A pallet of Aldahol was shipped on a local service truck to Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Philadelphia, PA. Upon opening the service truck to offload the materials, the facility crew noted a pallet of items that had broken apart during transportation. Cardboard boxes were no longer secured to the pallet with some on their sides with obvious signs of leakage from the inner packages. An investigation revealed the stretch-wrap securing the boxes to the pallet failed during transportation due to heavy containers stacked on top of lighter weight containers. The pallet was not sufficiently wrapped to secure the boxes for transportation. Trained Veolia facility employees removed the stretch wrap and upright the packages. The leaking packages were overpacked and the material was repalletized appropriately. The stretch wrap was wrapped to the pallet of containers utilizing a mechanical means to ensure proper stretch wrap tension and securement to the pallet.

The flight attendant met with the captain, and they elected to remove the battery and place the vape pen into a containment bag. The captain then returned to the flight deck and contacted dispatch.   • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1760 had a damaged cap and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the top of the drum. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads to wipe down the drum, then proceeded to repair the seal of the drum. Crews ensured there was no more leak, and the drum of product was good for shipment before staging it for further handling by terminal personnel. One (1) 5-gallon bucket of impacted absorbent pads and cleanup debris was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room.

  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3265 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately sixteen (16) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and patched the damaged tote. The crew conducted a tote transfer and swept up the spent absorbents. All impacted material was containerized in eight (8) 55-gallon drums for transport and disposal. The damaged 330-gallon tote and transferred tote of product were taken back to the terminal.

  • Description: On March 28, 2024, one (1) 275-gallon tote of sodium hydroxide had a leaking bung and released approximately twenty-five (25) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES closed the valve on the nozzle completely which halted the leak. HES placed a zip tie on the valve to prevent further accidental opening. All impacted absorbents and debris were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and staged onsite. The drum containing liquid product was labeled as hazardous waste and staged onsite for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024040105
item.description:
Report X-2024040105

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-08T15:12:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-26
  • City: NORTHBROOK
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED WITH FULL PPE AND RESPONSE CART TO SOUTH PRIMARY SORT AISLE TO PICK UP REPORTED LEAKING PACKAGE. RECTANGULAR PACKAGE IS INTACT, DISCOLORED AND SLIGHTLY SOFT ON ONE END. NO SPILLAGE TO CLEAN UP. PUT THE PACKAGE IN LINED SPILL TOTE AND PROMPTLY RETURNED IT TO THE PSC CAGE. UPON OPENING THE PACKAGE FOUND LARGE 3" DIAMETER TABLETS LINING TWO SIDES OF THE BOX AND A PLASTIC BIN INSIDE. THE PLASTIC BIN HAS AN OXIDIZER 5.1 YELLOW DIAMOND LABEL PRINTED ON ONE SIDE. THE LID SEAL ON THE BIN IS INTACT AND SEALED. THE LOOSE TABLETS AND SOME SMALL WADS OF NEWSPAPER LINE 2 SIDES OF THE BOX. THERE ARE NO LABELS ON THE USED OUTER CARTON, EXCEPT A PIECE OF PAPER TAPED ON BEARING THE NUMBERS 525D-619-010. CALLED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK AND SUBMITTED AN UNDECLARED HAZMAT REPORT. THIS PACKAGE WILL BE ENTERED INTO ETT AND HELD FOR INSPECTION.

The drums were relabeled as hazardous waste and will be handled as such. Customer was notified of all steps to resolve the waste shipment discrepancy

ALL PACKAGES FROM ALASKA TO MAINLAND TRAVEL VIA AIRCRAFT. OUTER PACKAGE WAS PREPRINTED KEEP FROZEN WITH A PARTIALLY REMOVED LABEL REFERENCING CHOCOLATE. THE PACKAGE WAS NOT GOING TO MAKE THE OUTBOUND FLIGHT ON FRIDAY SO IT WAS REMOVED FROM THE AIR CONTAINER AND SET ASIDE TO REMAIN IN THE FREEZER. PRIOR TO PLACING IN THE FREEZER AND DUE TO THE CHOCOLATE LABEL BEING PARTIALLY REMOVED, THE RESPONDER INSPECTED CONTENTS TO CONFIRM A FREEZER WAS NEEDED. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIFTY-THREE ELECTRONIC DEVICES CONSISTING OF CELL PHONES, IPADS, GAMING DEVICES, CAMERAS, AND E-READERS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM ALASKA USING ACCOUNT V92889, WIRELESS ALLIANCE, 1275 ROCK CREEK CIRCLE, LAFAYETTE CO 80026. UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHO SHIPPED THE PACKAGE IN AK.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2024, at 1223 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Blytheville, AR regarding the release of approximately (6) teaspoons of Chlorothalonil 98.5% PCT TC (Organochlorine pesticide, solid, toxic, UN2761, 6.1, II) from (1) 1012.3 lbs. bag. Upon arrival, contractors investigated and found no freestanding liquid or solids but confirmed that a material was released in small patches on the floor and is now completely dried. Contractors swept the entire trailer floor with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF which was then staged onsite by the contractor in preparation for proper disposal pending analysis.

item.description:

  • City: ROMEOVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 18, 2024 at 2000 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Roadrunner personnel in Romeoville, IL regarding the release of approximately (1) quart of Ammonium Hydroxide Solution (Corrosive liquid, basic, inorganic, n.o.s., UN3266, 8, II) from (1) 5-Liter poly bottle. The total amount of 5 liter bottles in this shipment was unknown. Terminal personnel cleaned the original spill and needed a contractor to address the leftover residue on the surface. Contractors were dispatched and upon arrival clarified that the area that needed to be cleaned was not the original spill area, but a section of the OS&D area where some of this material was spilled when it was placed into the waste bucket. The impacted area initially pH tested around a 10-11 so contractors utilized Simple Green and Acid Gator to bring it down to a 7. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then staged onsite by contractors for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040064
item.description:
Report E-2024040064

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-05T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-11
  • City: SOUTH CHARLESTON
  • State: WV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was driving a box truck loaded with a pair of totes and 15-20 55 gallon drums. Everything had been secured prior to leaving the customer's site with ratchet straps utilizing the e-track system in the truck. The road leaving the customer site grades down hill and as the driver was coming down hill he felt the load shift in the truck. The driver stopped at the stop sign at the bottom of the hill and exited the truck only to find that there was material leading from the front side of the truck cargo box. The totes had shifted and pulled the e-track away from the side of the truck, broke the clip that goes into the e-track, and slid forward in the cargo area of the truck, pushing a pallet jack into a poly drum filled with mostly water with trace amount of solvent. A corner of the pallet jack punched a hole in the poly drum releasing the contents out into the truck cargo area which left the truck and spilled on the road. The Veolia driver called the local Fire Department to respond to the spill. WV DEP was on scene along with a third party ER group to clean up the material left on the road. The road was closed both directions for a period of time until clean up of the road and berm soil were complete. Note that after further investigation the drum that was damaged was over 96% water with trace amounts of organic compounds. This was not an RQ release that required reporting.

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-09
  • City: AZUSA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A Veolia employee was unloading drums from a trailer at Veolia's ten day intransit facility in Azusa, CA. The employee used a forklift with a drum grabber attachment to pick up the 55 poly drum by it's lip. Prior to moving the drum, the drum appeared to be in good condition as there was no visible deficiencies identified by the forklift operator. Once the employee began to back up the drum, the drum lip broke off causing the drum to fall and break. Approximately 20 gallons was released onto the trailer and cement floor (all in secondary containment). The spill was immediately cleaned up. After investigating the incident, Veolia believes that the plastic was brittle but unfortunately, we are not sure of the cause of the brittleness since the site only utilizes a few of these drums.

item.title: Report E-2024030268
item.description:

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-04T15:13:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: WALBRIDGE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 75000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 03/07/2024, at 1232 hours, personnel in the CSXT Walbridge, OH yard, discovered CHIU 258609, a loaded container of Waste Environmentally Hazardous Substance Solid N.O.S. (Benzene, Mercury UN3077 Class 9), leaking. The container was isolated and the shipper, Clean Harbors, notified. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the container leaking from the door seam. It was presumed the release was due to a combination of an ineffective door seem and either a failure, or improper installation, of the box’s poly ethylene liner. Contractor personnel secured the package by applying additional sealant to the rear door of the container. The container was removed from the rail transportation and transported offsite via highway by the shipper. The issue was identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipper’s representative (Angel Villa 972-533-4154).

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that due to the container being impacted by a sharp object while unloading, approximately 5 gallons of MAT 50 Paint Thinner (hazardous - UN1263) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged jerrican, and oil-dri were placed into an 8 gallon metal drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.
